snippet: Two former aides to Gov. Chris Christie have refused to turn over documents related to the lane closings scandal, saying it would violate their right against self-incrimination.
abstract: Bridget Anne Kelly, former aide to New Jersey Gov Chris Christie, appears in Mercer County Court along with lawyers for Christie’s campaign manager Bill Stepien; lawyers for Kelly and Stepien are trying to quash subpoenas issued by special legislative committee investigating lane closings at the George Washington Bridge, inquiry that has threatened Christie’s political future.
lead_paragraph: Two former aides to Gov. Chris Christie have refused to turn over documents related to the lane closings scandal, saying it would violate their right against self-incrimination.

headline.main: Judge Hears Arguments on Subpoenas to Christie Associates
headline.print_headline: Judge Hears Arguments on Subpoenas to Christie Associates

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations
